summary: This is an automated court notification email from the CM/ECF system for the Southern District of New York, indicating the reassignment of the criminal case USA v. Maxwell from Judge Alison J. Nathan to Judge Vernon S. Broderick. The email includes a distribution list of attorneys and legal staff involved in the case.

connections.description: Judge Broderick is newly assigned to preside over the criminal case against Maxwell.
Judge Nathan was previously the presiding judge over Maxwell's criminal case.
David Boles is listed as an attorney of record on the case, indicating he is part of Maxwell's defense team.
Bobbi Sternheim is listed as an attorney of record on the case, indicating she is part of Maxwell's defense team.
Pomerantz is a prosecutor for the USA (government) in the case against Maxwell.

events.title: Case Reassignment of USA v. Maxwell
events.description: The criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell is reassigned from Judge Alison J. Nathan to Judge Vernon S. Broderick in the Southern District of New York.

locations: U.S. District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The criminal case USA v. Maxwell (1:20-cr-00330-VSB) was reassigned from Judge Alison J. Nathan to Judge Vernon S. Broderick on April 1, 2022.
The document is an automated court notification from the CM/ECF system, indicating a procedural change in the high-profile case.
A comprehensive list of attorneys and prosecutors involved in the case is provided, showing the legal teams for both the defense and the prosecution.
The case number 1:20-cr-00330-VSB confirms this is related to the criminal proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell following the Epstein investigation.
